content.rendered:
What is a Sales Supervisor?

Sales Supervisors are in charge of organizing and supervising day to day operations of sales representatives at a company.

Where does a Sales Supervisor work?

  • A sales role could require frequent travel
  • Office

How much does a Sales Supervisor make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Sales Supervisor is $44,835.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Sales Supervisors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business majors
  • Finance majors
  • Marketing majors
Search job opportunities on Handshake.

Sales Supervisor skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Sales Supervisor succeed in their work:

  • Great communication skills
  • Knowledge of applicable market insights
  • Strong delegation and strategy execution skills

What are some common questions about Sales Supervisors?

Q: What are the best degrees for sales jobs?

A: Business management, marketing, sales, or finance.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Sales Supervisor.
